intro: Litobrochia lactuca, commonly known as the milkweed of the genus Litobrochia, is a rare and specialized plant species. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the Apocynaceae family. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Litobrochia lactuca is often found in specific habitats, such as rocky soils or disturbed areas, and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
